verses.verse: {The Most Beautiful} {Song of Songs} d {Title} d The Most Beautiful Song by Solomon.
{The Loved One} d Let him kiss me over and over again! {Lit. me with the kisses of his mouth} Your love is better than wine.
The fragrance of your perfumed oil is wonderful. Your name is perfume poured out. Therefore the young women love you.

Take me with {Lit. Draw me after} you! Let's run away! Let the king bring me into his private chambers. {The Young Women} d The daughters {Or The young women} of Jerusalem {The Heb. lacks daughters of Jerusalem (cf. v. 5)} will rejoice and be happy for you. We will value your love more than wine. They love you appropriately.
{The Loved One} d The daughters {Or The young women} of Jerusalem, I'm dark and lovely like the tents of Kedar, like the curtains of Solomon.
Don't stare at me because I'm dark; the sun has tanned me. My mother's sons were angry with me. They made me the caretaker of the vineyards, but I didn't take care of my own vineyard.

Tell me, you whom I love, where do you graze your flock? Where do you make your flock lie down {Lit. where do you make to lie down} at noon? Why should I be considered a veiled woman {I. e. a prostitute} beside the flocks of your companions?
{The Lover} d If you don't know, most beautiful of women, go out after the flock and graze your young goats beside the shepherd's tents.
My darling, I compare you to a {Lit. my} mare among Pharaoh's chariots.
Your cheeks are lovely with ornaments, your neck with strings of jewels.
{The Young Women} d We will make ornaments of gold for you, accented with silver.
{The Loved One} d While the king was sitting at his table, my perfume sent forth its fragrance.
My beloved is to me a pouch of myrrh {I. e. a fragrant spice used as a perfume} that lies between my breasts all night.
My beloved is to me a cluster of henna {I. e. an aromatic shrub used cosmetically} blossoms in the vineyards of En-gedi.
{The Lover} d Look at you! You are beautiful, my darling. Look at you! You are so beautiful. Your eyes are doves.
{The Loved One} d Look at you! You are handsome, my beloved, truly lovely. How lush is our couch.
The beams of our house are cedar, our rafters are pine.
